title: Jeffrey Epstein’s Accusers Seek Justice at Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
sub_head: Prosecutors, lawyers, accusers have pushed on various legal fronts since financier’s 2019 death
body:
When Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in August 2019 while awaiting trial on allegations that he sexually abused dozens of underage girls, some of his accusers said they feared they would never get closure.
In the two years since his death, prosecutors, lawyers and accusers have pushed to hold Epstein and his associates accountable, seeking compensation from his estate and filing a civil racketeering suit against the estate’s executors.
